Title: N. Korea portrays leader Kim as 'benevolent father' in flood reco...
Description: North Korea touted the recovery of the country's flood-damaged northwestern regions as 'miracles' in reports released Monday, using the occasion to portray leader Kim Jong-un as a 'benevolent father.'

Title: Trump says he might demand Panama hand over canal
Description: President-elect Donald Trump on Saturday accused Panama of charging excessive rates for use of the Panama Canal and said that if Panama did not manage the canal in an acceptable fashion, he would demand the U.S. allay hand it over.

Title: Putin vows more 'destruction' on Ukraine after drone attack on Ru...
Description: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Sunday vowed to bring more 'destruction' to Ukraine in retaliation for a drone attack on a high-rise apartment block in the central Russian city of Kazan a day earlier.

Title: Syria leader vows country will not negatively interfere in Lebano...
Description: Syria's new leader Ahmed al-Sharaa told Lebanese Druze leaders on Sunday that his country would not negatively interfere in Lebanon and would respect its neighbour's sovereignty.

Title: Starbucks workers' union strikes across US as talks hit impasse
Description: Some members of the Starbucks workers' union that represents more than 10,000 baristas walked off their jobs in multiple U.S. cities on Friday, citing unresolved issues over wages, staffing and schedules.

Title: US strikes Huthi targets in Yemen, hours after rebels hit Israel
Description: The United States on Saturday said it struck targets in Yemen's rebel-held capital, hours after a Huthi rebel missile wounded people in Israel's commercial hub Tel Aviv.

Title: China faces AI talent shortage in an otherwise booming 'new econo...
Description: China's booming artificial intelligence (AI) industry has a plethora of job openings but not enough talent to fill them, according to a recent report from Maimai, a Chinese professional online network similar to LinkedIn.

Title: First grief, then more political tone at site of Germany Christma...
Description: A spontaneous memorial created by grieving families and local residents at a church overlooking Magdeburg's Christmas market evolved during Saturday into something more politically charged.

Title: Biden signs bill that averts government shutdown, brings close to...
Description: President Joe Biden signed a bill into law Saturday that averts a government shutdown, bringing a final close to days of upheaval after Congress approved a temporary funding plan just past the deadline and refused President-elect Donald Trump’s core debt demands in the package.

Title: N. Korean leader attends ceremony for rebuilt houses in flood-hit...
Description: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has attended a ceremony marking the completion of houses rebuilt after July's floods, emphasizing enhanced disaster response and self-rehabilitation, the country's state media reported Sunday.

Title: Malaysia agrees to resume 'no find, no fee' hunt for flight MH370...
Description: Malaysia's government has agreed in principle to accept a second 'no find, no fee' proposal from a U.S. company to renew the hunt for flight MH370, which is believed to have crashed in the southern Indian Ocean more than 10 years ago, Transport Minister Anthony Loke said Friday.

Title: US Senate passes government funding bill, averts shutdown
Description: The U.S. Congress passed spending legislation early on Saturday in a down-to-the wire burst of activity that will avert a destabilizing government shutdown ahead of the busy holiday travel season. The Democratic-controlled Senate in an 85-11 vote passed the bill to continue government funding 38 minutes after it expired at midnight (local times). The government did not invoke shutdown procedures in the interim.

Title: Numerous people injured after car drives into Christmas market in...
Description: Numerous people were injured on Friday after a car drove into a crowd of revellers at a Christmas market in the German city of Magdeburg, a city spokesperson told local broadcaster MDR.

Title: N. Korea slams S. Korea-US-Japan talks on Indo-Pacific as 'insult...
Description: North Korea lambasted a recent trilateral meeting between South Korea, the United States and Japan that discussed peace in the Indo-Pacific region, deriding the talks as an 'insult' to peace Saturday.

Title: N. Korean leader calls for stronger rural economies
Description: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un called to step up development of the country's industrial production in regions outside Pyongyang to strengthen rural economies, state media KCNA said on Saturday.

Title: Trump wants NATO members to increase defense spending to 5% of GD...
Description: Incoming U.S. President Donald Trump's team has told European officials that he will demand North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) member states raise their defense spending to 5 percent of gross domestic product (GDP), the Financial Times reported Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Title: Ukrainian military unveils footage of drone attacks on NK soldier...
Description: The Ukrainian military released more video footage of its forces apparently killing North Korean soldiers with a drone on the frontlines in the Kursk border region, a Ukrainian media outlet has reported, amid reports of North Korean forces suffering heavy casualties.

Title: N. Korean economy grows 3.1% in 2023, snapping 3-year contraction...
Description: North Korea's economy expanded by more than 3 percent last year, rebounding from three consecutive years of contraction, data showed Friday, on the back of increased trade with China following the easing of border restrictions in the post-COVID-19 period.

Title: US suffers first severe human case of bird flu; California declar...
Description: The U.S. reported its first severe human case of bird flu on Wednesday in a Louisiana resident who is hospitalized in critical condition after suspected contact with an infected backyard flock.

Title: Putin boasts of gains in Ukraine at annual news conference meant ...
Description: President Vladimir Putin boasted that his military operation in Ukraine has strengthened Russia and denied that the ouster of key ally Bashar Assad in Syria had hurt Moscow’s prestige, as he took questions at his annual news conference and call-in show Thursday.

Title: House rejects Trump-backed plan on government shutdown, leaving n...
Description: With a resounding no, the House rejected President-elect Donald Trump's new plan Thursday to fund federal operations and suspend the debt ceiling a day before a government shutdown, as Democrats and dozens of Republicans refused to accommodate his sudden demands.

Title: Bank of England warns of 'heightened uncertainty' as it keeps int...
Description: The U.K.’s central bank warned Thursday of 'heightened uncertainty' as it kept interest rates on hold after inflation moved further above target, even at a time when the British economy is flatlining at best.

Title: Gisele Pelicot's ex-husband found guilty of rapes, sentenced to 2...
Description: A court in France on Thursday sentenced the ex-husband of Gisele Pelicot to 20 years in prison for drugging and raping her and allowing other men to rape her while she was unconscious, in abuse that lasted nearly a decade.

Title: More than 100 NK soldiers killed, over 1000 injured in Russia-Ukr...
Description: At least 100 North Korean soldiers deployed to fight against Ukrainian forces in Russia's Kursk region have been killed, with nearly 1,000 reported injured, the National Intelligence Service (NIS) said, Thursday. This marks the first official confirmation from South Korea's intelligence agency regarding the scale of casualties among North Korean troops in Russia.

Title: Gaza mediators intensify ceasefire efforts, Israeli strikes kill ...
Description: The United States, joined by Arab mediators, sought to conclude an agreement between Israel and Hamas to halt the 14-month-old war in the Gaza Strip, where medics said Israeli strikes killed at least 20 Palestinians on Wednesday.

Title: US Supreme Court agrees to review law banning Chinese-owned video...
Description: The U.S. Supreme Court said on Wednesday that it had agreed to review a U.S. law that mandates a nationwide ban of the popular Chinese-owned video app TikTok if it fails to secure a non-Chinese buyer by January 19.

Title: Yen drops as Bank of Japan maintains key interest rate
Description: The yen fell against the dollar on Thursday as the Bank of Japan (BoJ) left borrowing costs unchanged, extending a retreat for the currency after the Federal Reserve forecast fewer rate cuts.

Title: N. Korea can produce ballistic missiles for Russia to use against...
Description: North Korea demonstrated this year that it could produce ballistic missiles and supply them to Russia for use against Ukraine in a matter of months, the head of a research organization that traces weapons used in the war said Wednesday.

Title: US alarmed Russia close to accepting nuclear-armed N. Korea
Description: The United States voiced alarm at the United Nations Security Council on Wednesday that Russia was close to accepting a nuclear-armed North Korea, as Moscow and Pyongyang defended their growing cooperation.

Title: Fed lowers rates but sees fewer cuts in 2025 due to stubbornly hi...
Description: The U.S. central bank lowered interest rates on Wednesday, but Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said more reductions in borrowing costs hinge on further progress in lowering stubbornly high inflation, remarks that showed policymakers are beginning to reckon with the prospects for sweeping economic change under an incoming Trump administration.

Title: France's highest court upholds Sarkozy's corruption conviction
Description: The Cour de Cassation, France's highest court, upheld on Wednesday former President Nicolas Sarkozy's conviction for corruption and influence peddling.

Title: Xi visits casino hub Macao to mark 25 years of its return to Chin...
Description: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Wednesday began a three-day visit to Macao to mark the 25th anniversary of the casino city’s return to Chinese rule.

Title: First flight since Assad's fall departs Syrian capital
Description: The first flight since the ouster of Syria's president Bashar al-Assad took off on Wednesday from Damascus airport to Aleppo in the country's north, AFP journalists saw.

Title: Honda, Nissan move to deepen ties, including possible merger: sou...
Description: Honda and Nissan are in talks to deepen ties, two people said on Wednesday, including a possible merger, the clearest sign yet of how Japan's once seemingly unbeatable auto industry is being reshaped by challenges from Tesla and Chinese rivals.

Title: Power failed at SpaceX mission control before September spacewalk...
Description: A September power outage at a California facility of SpaceX, the space venture of billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk, caused a loss of ground control for at least an hour during a mission that included the first private spacewalk in history, according to three people familiar with the problem.

Title: What does Big Tech hope to gain from warming up to Trump?
Description: In a string of visits, dinners, calls, monetary pledges and social media overtures, big tech chiefs - including Apple's Tim Cook , OpenAI’s Sam Altman , Meta’s Mark Zuckerberg , SoftBank's Masayoshi Son and Amazon’s Jeff Bezos - have joined a parade of business and world leaders in trying to improve their standing with President-elect Donald Trump before he takes office in January.

Title: Netanyahu says Israeli troops will occupy buffer zone inside Syri...
Description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Tuesday that Israeli forces will stay in a buffer zone on the Syrian border, seized after the ouster of Syria's President Bashar Assad, until another arrangement is in place 'that ensures Israel's security.'

Title: Gaza ceasefire talks gain momentum as officials push for deal
Description: An agreement to halt the 14-month-old war in Gaza and free hostages held in the Palestinian enclave could be signed in the coming days with talks in Cairo making progress, sources briefed on the meeting said on Tuesday.

Title: Ukraine kills Russian chemical weapons chief Igor Kirillov in Mos...
Description: A top Russian general accused by Ukraine of being responsible for the use of chemical weapons against Ukrainian troops was assassinated in Moscow by Ukraine's SBU intelligence service on Tuesday morning in the most high-profile killing of its kind.

Title: N. Korean leader visits mausoleum to pay tribute to late father o...
Description: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has visited a mausoleum for his late father to mark the 13th anniversary of his death, the North's state media reported Wednesday.

Title: US sanctions 2 individuals, 1 entity involved in money laundering...
Description: The United States on Tuesday sanctioned two individuals and one entity involved in a network that launders illicit funds generated by North Korean IT workers and cybercrime to support Pyongyang, the Treasury Department said.

Title: UN General Assembly adopts resolution on N. Korean human rights f...
Description: The U.N. General Assembly on Tuesday passed a resolution on North Korean human rights for the 20th consecutive year, calling for improvement in the reclusive state's human rights record.

Title: UN Security Council to hold briefing on NK-Russia military cooper...
Description: The U.N. Security Council (UNSC) is set to hold a briefing later this week to discuss North Korea's deepening military cooperation with Russia, amid growing concerns over North Korean troops' engagement in combat alongside Russian forces against Ukraine.

Title: Hundreds of N. Korean troops killed, wounded in battle with Ukrai...
Description: Hundreds of North Korean troops fighting alongside Russian soldiers against Ukrainian forces in the Kursk region have been killed or wounded, according to news reports that cited a U.S. military official.

Title: Denmark will not extradite anti-whaling activist Paul Watson to J...
Description: Denmark has rejected a Japanese request to extradite anti-whaling activist Paul Watson over criminal charges dating back more than a decade, a Danish lawyer representing Watson said on Tuesday.

Title: Stock markets mostly drop awaiting Fed policy update
Description: Major stock markets mostly fell Tuesday as attention turned to the Federal Reserve's upcoming policy decision, with traders hoping for guidance on its interest rate plans as president-elect Donald Trump prepares to take office.

Title: Donald Trump's deportation plan sparks fear, doubt, skepticism
Description: President-elect Donald Trump promises to undertake the largest deportation program in U.S. history, prompting fear among immigrants, although immigration attorneys say it will be a tall task.

Title: Americans' trust in nation's court system hits record low, survey...
Description: At a time of heightened political division, Americans' confidence in their country’s judicial system and courts dropped to a record low of 35 percent this year, according to a new Gallup poll .

Title: Top military officer inspects partially restored guard post insid...
Description: South Korea's top military officer on Tuesday visited a partially restored guard post inside the Demilitarized Zone separating the two Koreas to inspect troop readiness against North Korean threats, his office said.

Title: Abductee family group vows to go ahead with leaflet campaigns aga...
Description: A group representing the families of those abducted by North Korea said Tuesday it would fly leaflets into North Korea 'shortly' despite the unification minister's calls for a 'prudent' approach to the leaflet campaign.

Title: China, Trump talk up prospects for US-China collaboration
Description: China's top diplomat said on Tuesday he hoped the incoming Trump administration would 'make the right choice' and work with Beijing, hours after Donald Trump told reporters the COVID-19 pandemic had strained his relationship with 'friend' Xi Jinping.

Title: Assad gives account of last hours before leaving Syria
Description: Syria's Bashar al-Assad issued his first statement since being toppled from power, saying he was evacuated to Russia from the Hmeimim base on Dec. 8 as it came under drone attack, after leaving Damascus that morning with rebel fighters closing in.

Title: Zelenskyy shares video of Russian soldier allegedly setting fire ...
Description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has shared a video he claimed to be a Russian soldier setting fire to the body of a North Korean soldier killed in combat against Ukraine, saying that the move aimed to hide the presence of North Korean troops fighting alongside Russia.

Title: NIS sees N. Korean troops' casualties in combat against Ukraine a...
Description: South Korea's spy agency said Tuesday it is verifying intelligence about North Korean troops' fatalities during combat alongside Russian forces against Ukraine, saying it is taking into account the possibility that it could be true.

Title: S. Korea sanctions top NK military officers, missile developer in...
Description: South Korea said Tuesday it will impose sanctions on three top North Korean military officers and one missile developer believed to have been deployed to Russia in support of its war against Ukraine, the first such sanctions designation since the North's troop deployment was confirmed.

Title: S. Korea begins production of spy drones for NK surveillance
Description: South Korea has kicked off the production of the medium-altitude unmanned aerial vehicle (MUAV), the arms procurement agency said Tuesday, in a move to help enhance the military's surveillance capabilities over North Korea.

Title: Germany's Scholz loses confidence vote, setting up early election...
Description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz lost a confidence vote in the German parliament on Monday, putting the European Union’s most populous member and biggest economy on course to hold an early election in February.

Title: Teacher, teenage student killed in shooting at private Christian ...
Description: A teenage student opened fire with a handgun Monday at a private Christian school in Wisconsin, killing a teacher and another teenager during the final week before Christmas break. The shooter also died, police said.

Title: US sanctions NK generals accompanying NK troops dispatched to Rus...
Description: The United States on Monday sanctioned two North Korean generals known to be accompanying thousands of North Korean troops dispatched to support Russia in its war against Ukraine, as well as other people and entities linked to Pyongyang's military programs and other activities.

Title: Nigeria says to reopen embassy in N. Korea following years of COV...
Description: Nigeria was set to reopen its embassy in North Korea following years of closure over the COVID-19 pandemic, the Russian Embassy in Pyongyang has said, a move seen as making it the first African country to resume diplomatic activities in the North.

Title: US confirms N. Korean fatalities in combat against Ukraine
Description: The United States has seen North Korean troops killed in action during combat alongside Russian forces against Ukraine, a State Department spokesperson confirmed Monday, warning that should they cross the border into Ukraine, it would mark 'yet another escalation.'

Title: SoftBank CEO to announce $100 bill. investment in US during visit...
Description: SoftBank Group CEO Masayoshi Son will announce a $100 billion investment in the U.S. over the next four years during a Monday visit to U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's residence Mar-a-Lago, CNBC reported on Monday.

Title: Death toll in Gaza Strip from Israel-Hamas war tops 45,000, Pales...
Description: The death toll in the Gaza Strip from the 14-month war between Israel and Hamas militants has topped 45,000 people, Palestinian health officials said Monday, with 52 dead arriving at hospitals across the bombed-out strip over the past 24 hours.

Title: Unification minister urges 'prudent' stance for anti-Pyongyang le...
Description: Unification Minister Kim Yung-ho called for a 'prudent' approach Monday to sending anti-Pyongyang leaflets across the border, in an apparent shift from an earlier stance on the campaign led by South Korean activists that Pyongyang has bristled at.

Title: Trump hosts Shinzo Abe's widow at Mar-a-Lago
Description: U.S. president-elect Donald Trump hosted Akie Abe, the widow of slain former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, for a private dinner with his wife Melania Trump at their Mar-a-Lago residence in Florida on Sunday.

Title: Several hundreds, maybe thousands, may have died in Mayotte cyclo...
Description: Several hundred people, maybe even thousands, may have been killed by Cyclone Chido in the French archipelago of Mayotte in the Indian Ocean, a top local French official said via local media channel Mayotte La 1ere on Sunday.

Title: Brazil's Lula discharged from hospital following emergency surger...
Description: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva was discharged Sunday from a Sao Paulo hospital following emergency surgery to treat an intracranial hemorrhage.

Title: 200 Russian, NK troops allegedly killed in combat against Ukraine...
Description: Some 200 Russian and North Korean soldiers were estimated to have been killed while fighting in combined units against Ukrainian forces, Kyiv's intelligence authorities said, without specifying the number of casualties for each side.

Title: Constitutional Court says begins Yoon impeachment hearings
Description: Korea's constitutional court on Monday kicked off proceedings on the impeachment of President Yoon Suk Yeol, suspended from office over his failed bid to impose martial law.

Title: N. Korea reports Yoon's impeachment 2 days after parliamentary vo...
Description: North Korea's state media on Monday reported on President Yoon Suk Yeol's impeachment, two days after South Korea's National Assembly voted to impeach Yoon over his botched imposition of martial law earlier this month.

Title: Syrian authorities reopen schools, a week after upheaval that ove...
Description: Students returned to classrooms in Syria on Sunday after the country's new rulers ordered schools reopened in a potent sign of some normalcy a week after rebels swept into the capital in the dramatic overthrow of President Bashar al-Assad.

Title: China stamps out tech misuse to preserve national literature and ...
Description: Beijing is stepping up its defense of classic literature against AI misuse that it says could undermine and endanger China's leading ideology.

Title: Isak Andic, founder of Spanish fashion brand Mango, dies in accid...
Description: Isak Andic, the founder of Spanish fashion brand Mango, has died after suffering an accident, the company said on Saturday. He was 71.

Title: N. Korea remains silent about Yoon's impeachment
Description: North Korea's state media on Sunday kept mum about President Yoon Suk Yeol's impeachment, marking a contrast from its swift reporting of the 2016 impeachment of then President Park Geun-hye.

Title: Trump picks Richard Grenell as envoy for special missions
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump on Saturday said he was picking Richard Grenell, his former intelligence chief, as his presidential envoy for special missions.

Title: Russia using N. Korean troops in bid to reclaim Kursk: Zelenskyy
Description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Saturday that Russia had begun deploying North Korean soldiers to storm Ukrainian positions in the Kursk region.

Title: Trump hosts Apple CEO at Mar-a-Lago as big tech leaders continue ...
Description: Donald Trump hosted Apple CEO Tim Cook for a Friday evening dinner at the president-elect's Mar-a-Lago resort, according to a person familiar with the matter who was not authorized to comment publicly.

Title: China's Xi to attend Macau 25th handover anniv. next week: Xinhua
Description: Chinese President Xi Jinping will visit Macau next week for a gathering marking 25 years since the former Portuguese colony's handover to China, state news agency Xinhua said Saturday.

Title: France's Macron names centrist ally Bayrou as PM
Description: President Emmanuel Macron on Friday named centrist leader Francois Bayrou as prime minister, handing him the daunting task of hauling France out of months of political crisis.

Title: Moldova declares emergency ahead of expected Russia gas cuts
Description: Moldova's parliament approved Friday a 60-day state of emergency as an expected cut of Russian gas to the power station that supplies a majority of its electricity could trigger blackouts.

Title: China gives vocational training hi-tech overhaul to upskill workf...
Description: China is overhauling its vocational education courses to expand the pool of hi-tech workers for strategic sectors.

Title: Trump invited China's Xi to his inauguration even as he threatene...
Description: President-elect Donald Trump has invited Chinese President Xi Jinping to attend his inauguration next month - extending a diplomatic olive branch even as Trump threatens to levy massive tariffs on Chinese goods.

Title: Meta donates $1 million to Trump's inauguration fund
Description: Meta, the parent company of Facebook and Instagram, said it has donated $1 million to President-elect Donald Trump's inauguration fund.

Title: US sets up reward of up to $5 mil. for info on NK IT firms, worke...
Description: The United States offered Thursday to provide a reward of up to $5 million for information on two North Korean information technology (IT) firms, accusing them of exploiting workers to generate revenue to support the reclusive regime in Pyongyang.

Title: Trump calls NK role in Russia's war 'complicating' factor, says h...
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump has said that Pyongyang's involvement in Russia's war in Ukraine is a 'very complicating' factor, while boasting about his personal ties with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un.

Title: US leaves N. Korea on state sponsors of terrorism list in 2023 re...
Description: The United States has kept North Korea on its list of state sponsors of terrorism, an annual State Department report showed Thursday, noting the reclusive regime repeatedly supported acts of international terrorism.

Title: Biden approves national security memo on China, Iran, North Korea...
Description: President Joe Biden has approved a new national security memorandum ahead of Donald Trump's return to the White House that could serve as a road map for the incoming administration as it looks to counter growing cooperation among China, Iran, North Korea and Russia, the White House said Wednesday.

Title: Japan's Nissan reshuffles management to fix its money-losing busi...
Description: Embattled Japanese automaker Nissan has tapped Jeremie Papin, who was overseeing its U.S. operations, as its chief financial officer in a major management reshuffle billed as key to a turnaround.

Title: Japan plans to raise key taxes in 2026 to fund defense budget exp...
Description: Japan's government plans to raise the country's key taxes starting in April 2026 to fund more defense spending after a one-year delay, according to a document seen by Reuters on Thursday.

Title: K-pop star Rain dazzles at Hong Kong International Races with ele...
Description: K-pop star Rain put in a brief but much-anticipated appearance at the opening of the Longines Hong Kong International Races at the Sha Tin Racecourse in Hong Kong on Dec. 8.

Title: Trump invites China's Xi Jinping to attend inauguration: CBS News
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump has invited Chinese President Xi Jinping to attend his inauguration next month, CBS News reported on Wednesday, citing multiple sources.

Title: Biden approves national security memo on China, Iran, North Korea...
Description: President Joe Biden has approved a new national security memorandum ahead of Donald Trump's return to the White House that could serve as a road map for the incoming administration as it looks to counter growing cooperation among China, Iran, North Korea and Russia, the White House said Wednesday.

Title: US House endorses annual defense policy bill, including maintaini...
Description: The House of Representatives passed an annual defense policy bill Wednesday that calls for maintaining 28,500 American troops in Korea and reaffirming the United States' deterrence commitment to the Asian ally.

Title: Afghan refugees minister killed by suicide blast: gov't source
Description: The Afghan minister for refugees was killed on Wednesday in a suicide explosion at the ministry's offices in the capital Kabul, a government source told AFP.

Title: Trump plans major reshaping of U.S. policies within hours of taki...
Description: President-elect Donald Trump is planning a blizzard of more than 25 executive orders and directives on his first day in office on Jan. 20 as he seeks to dramatically reshape U.S. government policy on issues from immigration to energy.

Title: Biden approves national security memo aimed at helping Trump on C...
Description: President Joe Biden has approved a new national security memorandum that is meant to serve as a roadmap for the incoming Trump administration as it looks to counter growing cooperation among China, Iran, North Korea and Russia, the White House said Wednesday.

Title: Khamenei says Assad's fall will not weaken Iran
Description: Iran's supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said Wednesday the weakening of the anti-Israel 'resistance' after the ouster of Bashar al-Assad in Syria would not diminish Tehran's power.

Title: US defense secretary in Japan to support alliance as Osprey aircr...
Description: U.S. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin met with officials in Japan on Tuesday to reaffirm the importance of their alliance and Washington's commitment to regional security as threats rise from China and North Korea.

Title: Death toll from contaminated infant IV feeding bags in Mexico ris...
Description: Authorities in Mexico said Tuesday that a total of 17 children have died in central Mexico from suspected contamination of IV feeding bags after four more deaths were confirmed.

Title: UnitedHealth murder suspect has angry outburst as details of his ...
Description: Luigi Mangione, the suspect charged with murder in the shooting of a top UnitedHealth executive, briefly struggled with officers and angrily shouted while being escorted into a Pennsylvania courthouse on Tuesday, as a clearer picture of his motives began to emerge a day after his arrest ended a massive manhunt.

Title: Russian Embassy in N. Korea hosts reception on ratification of mu...
Description: The Russian Embassy in North Korea has hosted a reception to celebrate the ratification of a mutual defense treaty between the two nations, the North's state media reported Wednesday.

Title: N. Korea reports S. Korea's martial law turmoil for 1st time
Description: North Korea's state media on Wednesday reported on the martial law turmoil in South Korea for the first time, including the opposition's push to impeach President Yoon Suk Yeol, while blaming Yoon for causing nationwide chaos.

Title: Jordanian man returns home after 38 years in Syria's prisons
Description: A Jordanian man has returned to his home country after spending 38 years in Syrian jails, an official said on Tuesday, after the fall of president Bashar al-Assad ended an agonising wait for his family.

Title: China sends largest naval fleet in decades to region, threat leve...
Description: China is deploying its largest navy fleet in regional waters in nearly three decades, posing a threat to Taiwan that is more pronounced than previous Chinese war games, the Taiwanese defense ministry said on Tuesday.

Title: China's consumer inflation hits 5-month low, leaves room for more...
Description: China's weak consumer price growth in November leaves plenty of room for further monetary policy easing, with earlier stimulus having eased fears of deflation, analysts said.

Title: N. Korean media remain tight-lipped on martial law turmoil in Sou...
Description: North Korea has not reported on last week's martial law declaration in South Korea or its fallout in the following week through Tuesday, including the opposition's push to impeach President Yoon Suk Yeol.

Title: Google says it has cracked quantum computing challenge with new c...
Description: Google on Monday said that it has overcome a key challenge in quantum computing with a new generation of chip, solving a computing problem in five minutes that would take a classical computer more time than the history of the universe.

Title: Nobel laureate warns Putin about danger of nuclear weapons
Description: This year's Nobel Peace Prize laureate, Japan's atomic bomb survivors' group Nihon Hidankyo, on Monday urged Russia to stop issuing nuclear threats in a bid to prevail in its war in Ukraine.

Title: Australia-based S. Korean reunites with separated relatives in N....
Description: A South Korean national residing in Australia traveled to North Korea and met with two nephews in October in the first privately arranged separated families reunion in five years, the South Korean unification ministry said Tuesday.

Title: With Syria's Assad gone, his PM agrees to hand power to rebel adm...
Description: Ousted Syrian President Bashar al-Assad's prime minister said he had agreed on Monday to hand power to the rebel-led Salvation Government, a day after the rebels seized the capital Damascus and Assad fled to Russia.

Title: Trump promises to end birthright citizenship: What is it, could h...
Description: President-elect Donald Trump has promised to end birthright citizenship as soon as he gets into office to make good on campaign promises aiming to restrict immigration and redefining what it means to be American.

Title: Suspect in killing of UnitedHealth executive Brian Thompson in cu...
Description: Authorities have arrested the man suspected of killing UnitedHealth executive Brian Thompson in a brazen shooting outside a Manhattan hotel last week, New York City officials said on Monday, ending a massive five-day manhunt.

Title: Top nuclear envoys of Seoul, Washington, Tokyo vow coordination a...
Description: The top nuclear envoys of South Korea, the United States and Japan vowed close coordination Monday to manage 'future situations stably' in the event of any possible provocations by North Korea, Seoul's foreign ministry said.

Title: Polarization' is Merriam-Webster's 2024 word of year
Description: The results of the 2024 U.S. presidential election rattled the country and sent shockwaves across the world - or were cause for celebration, depending on who you ask. Is it any surprise then that the Merriam-Webster word of the year is 'polarization?'

Title: Kremlin refuses to confirm if Assad in Russia
Description: The Kremlin declined on Monday to confirm reports that toppled Syrian president Bashar al-Assad had fled to Moscow, adding that it was 'surprised' by the rebel takeover.

Title: Trump says he will not try to replace Fed's Powell
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump said in an interview aired on Sunday he will not try to replace Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell upon taking office in January.

Title: Jack Ma makes rare speech at Ant Group's 20th anniversary, predic...
Description: Jack Ma, the founder of Alibaba Group Holding, gave a rare public speech at the 20th anniversary of the company's fintech affiliate Ant Group, saying he had faith in the 'next 20 years of Ant' and expects 'more miracles', according to Chinese media reports and people who were there.

Title: Trump says he can't guarantee tariffs won't raise prices, won't r...
Description: Donald Trump said he can't guarantee that his promised tariffs on key U.S. foreign trade partners won't raise prices for American consumers and he suggested once more that some political rivals and federal officials who pursued legal cases against him should be imprisoned.

Title: At Gulf bitcoin gathering, Trump family and allies to bask in cry...
Description: Several key players in President-elect Donald Trump's new cryptocurrency venture head to Abu Dhabi on Monday for the largest bitcoin gathering in the Gulf region as the digital currency sets record highs. Speakers include the president-elect's son Eric and billionaire Steve Witkoff, the new White House envoy for the Middle East and co-founder of World Liberty Financial, a crypto platform launched in September that Donald Trump and his family helped form.
